@description.name: @description
@description.body: A Input wrap any valid HTML input element and make it accessible through the normalized qooxdoo element interface.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} The type of the input field. Valid values are text, textarea, select, checkbox, radio, password, hidden, submit, image, file, search, and reset.
@param.description: The type of the input field. Valid values are text, textarea, select, checkbox, radio, password, hidden, submit, image, file, search, and reset.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
styles {Map?null} optional map of CSS styles, where the key is the name
    of the style and the value is the value to use.
@param.description:
optional map of CSS styles, where the key is the name
    of the style and the value is the value to use.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
attributes {Map?null} optional map of element attributes, where the
    key is the name of the attribute and the value is the value to use.
@param.description:
optional map of element attributes, where the
    key is the name of the attribute and the value is the value to use.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the input element enabled / disabled. Webkit needs a special treatment because the set color of the input field changes automatically. Therefore, we use -webkit-user-modify: read-only and -webkit-user-select: none for disabling the fields in webkit. All other browsers use the disabled attribute.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Boolean} true, if the input element should be enabled.
@param.description: true, if the input element should be enabled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set whether the element is selectable. It uses the qooxdoo attribute qxSelectable with the values 'on' or 'off'. In webkit, a special css property will be used and checks for the enabled state.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Boolean} True, if the element should be selectable.
@param.description: True, if the element should be selectable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the value of the input element.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.html.Input} This instance for for chaining support.
@return.description: This instance for for chaining support.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the text wrap behavior of a text area element. This property uses the style property "wrap" (IE) respectively "whiteSpace"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: wrap {Boolean} Whether to turn text wrap on or off.
@param.description: Whether to turn text wrap on or off.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
direct {Boolean?false} Whether the execution should be made
  directly when possible
@param.description:
Whether the execution should be made
  directly when possible

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.html.Input} This instance for for chaining support.
@return.description: This instance for for chaining support.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the text wrap behavior of a text area element. This property uses the style property "wrap" (IE) respectively "whiteSpace"

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether wrapping is enabled or disabled.
@return.description: Whether wrapping is enabled or disabled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
